fields.summary: Please include support for MicroSoft Visual SourceSafe

fields.description:
List of steps to recreate the problem. 


Start with new repo
mkdir projectA 
mkdir projectA/subproject
vi projectA/subproject/file.txt (add text and save file)
svn add projectA
mkdir projects
svn add projects
svn ci -m "added dirs" 
svn move projectA projects/.
svn propset svn:ignore "+ Task.java~" projects/projectA/subproject
svn status (Ensure that there is a M next to projects/projectA/subproject
svn ci -m "added propset with move"

Next start fisheye, add the repo above and index. 

Navigate to your projects/subproject and it will be displayed as a file. 

Added dump of my repo if you need it.
fields.summary: Directories mistakingly get indexed as files

fields.description: Example: http://svn.atlassian.com/fisheye/qsearch/public/contrib/jira/jira-fisheye-plugin?q=pom.xml The breadcrumb link params up the top have encoded param separators, e.g.: {code}jira-fisheye-plugin{code} This breaks the search.
fields.summary: "Search just <repo:parh>" breadcrumb links are borked - escapes parameter separators

fields.description: It seems that sometimes DiffFetcher can be created and ran but it will not terminate - this will make FishEye to spawn more and more threads up to java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: unable to create new native thread, it happens under stress and is a result of previous OOM: java heap space errors.
fields.summary: Force stop of a DiffFetcher thread in case of exceptions

fields.description:
I don't see if there unit specified for SVN Operation timeout in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/1.6+Subversion
From what I understand this value is given in miliseconds.

We could also add some support for time value specifiers (like m for minutes, h for hours and so on).
fields.summary: Specify time unit for SVN Operation timeout

fields.description:
Some of check-in notices for wartches identified as Junk E-mail by exchange server.
Could you give us some idea about the posiible reasons and resolutions?

Another issue is The Subjetc of "Watches" notice, displayed {[Crucible], like [Crucible] depot-Platform:/EnterpriseSearch 8194 by senevy Remove try/catch since less ...
Could you tell me which file I can edit and change the Subject of "Watches" notice email as [FishEye] and 
it still display [Crucible] for Code review notice.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Some of check-in notices for wartches identified as Junk E-mail by exchange server

fields.description:
If you integrate with some external usermanagement such as crowd, you can create groups that have & in them, for example R&D. 

When viewing these groups you will have problems as the & is not encoded thus leading to fisheye believing the D is a new parameter rather than treating R&D as one parameter. 

e.g. 
[http://<fisheye_url>/admin/userAdmin.do?filterEmail=&filterGroup=R&D]

The correct url should output as 

[http://<fisheye_url>/admin/userAdmin.do?filterEmail=&filterGroup=R%26D]

The same goes for usernames.
fields.summary: Username & groups that contain characters such as '&' could cause problems when viewing such groups/users via the UI due to the fact that the urls are not encoded.

fields.description: Allow searches to be saved and shared in much the same way as filters are able to be saved in JIRA. This would be especially handy if searches could be used as constraints.
fields.summary: Saved searches / Shared Filters
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in CalculatedBucketGraphXY

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to switch between branches in Perforce.  I am also not certain the best way to set up a repository for perforce with branches considered.  

- one repository with all branches under it? 
- one repository per branch?

the branch information could be read from the branch specs or just using fisheye configuration
fields.summary: Fisheye support for perforce branches

fields.description:
if you select "Previous" from the dropdown, the r2 query param is blank

see screenshot
fields.summary: diff-to-previous on annotate page 404s

fields.description: Currently System information does not include java version or os information. Sometimes customers fail to provide us with log files or there files have the relevant section missing, thus we lose this information which is usually included right after a restart in the logs.
fields.summary: In system information include java version and os information
The default jsvn should be automatically updated to include the correct svnkit version that is bundled with the build.

fields.description: Currently the application needs to be restarted in order to turn on debugging, however,especially for easily reproducible problems, it would be good to allow admins to toggle debug mode from within the application itself.
fields.summary: Allow admins to turn on debugging via the admin UI

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) Go into profile
2) Click delete link next to watch
3) Watch is shown as deleted
4) Wait until the deleted watch would be triggered by a commit

Expected result: 
No email, watch remains deleted

Actual result:
Still receive watch email, if you go back into the profile the watch has reappeared

Notes:
This is on my account in FishEye and the watch is setup for the root level of a configured repository. I assume this was part of your standard release testing, so maybe our use of the lowercase usernames flag in the config is messing up the watch deletion (its trying to delete with the non-LC username or vice versa and thinks its successful when it isn't).
fields.summary: Watches still not deleted
Add 'ancestor' return clause to EyeQL

fields.description:
Yesterday we have faced to the situation again when, all of our Fisheye p4 related repositories (120) was in 2-3hours syncronisation delay  (incemental indexing), even if the "Incremental Indexing Threads" set  to 9 (Initial Indexing Threads set to 4)
After discussing our other performance problems which we have reported in  https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-782
and we got  some bugfixes, we though that this delay problem is fixed.
But unfortunately it seems that we now facing to exactly the same problem even if we have explicitly set "P4 Operation Timeout 10" for every repositories:
   - Some repositories hangs on "Enabled: Running" status but the "Last Update" columns is blank
   - These repositories usually in "Contacting repository" status 
If all of the paralelly runable p4 client goes to this state then the syncronisation of other repositories merely blocked.
Accroding to our earlier expereinces stop all the repositories and start them again could solve this problem , but not now.
So 1 hour after every repository stopped still these repositories in "Enabled: Stopping" state. After checking the runing processes 
a lot of p4 client process still runing.
Then the next thought was to just simply kill these p4 processes, but the fisheye instance (the parent process) open new p4 processes
very fast (more then one in a second and close them immediately as well).
This problem recodnised 28 hours ago and still there is a repository which still in the "Enabled: Stopping" status even if the 
"P4 Operation Timeout 10" set on this as well. 
The other problematic repositories stopped after 4-5 hours.
fields.summary: Stop Fisheye repository does not work

Documentation: Add maxReturn parameter to remote API

fields.description:
We need to update http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/4.+EyeQL+Reference+Guide with the new SQL-style LIMIT clause:

*select revisions*
(*from* (*dir\|directory*) _word_)?
(*where* _clauses_)?
(*order by date* (*asc* | *desc*)? )?
Notes: _asc_ produces 'ascending order'.
       _desc_ produces 'descending order'.
(*group by* (*file*\|*dir*\|*directory*\|*changeset*))?
(*return* _return-clauses_)?

with:

(*limit* _limit-args_)?

added at the end after the *return* clause description.

We'll also have to add a description of _limit-args_ down the bottom somewhere:

( _duration_ | _offset_ , _duration_ | _duration_ *offset* _offset_ )
Notes: Limits the number of results to return. _Offset_ specifies the starting point of the truncated result set and _duration_ specifies it's length.
fields.summary: Add LIMIT clause to EyeQL documentation

fields.description:
Improve the file history page:

Ideas: 
* Cleaner layout
* Better navigation
* Sortable fields
* Filterable fields (i.e. just show me revisions I committed)
* Consistent linking
* ++
fields.summary: Refactor file history page.

fields.description:
When selecting the Source tab for a project where the user does not have permissions, an error page should be displayed, rather that a 403 error page.

It's Jetty's 403 page, which Fisheye doesn't override - see WEB-INF/web.xml:

<error-page>
        <error-code>404</error-code>
        <location>/404.jsp</location>
    </error-page>
    <error-page>
        <error-code>500</error-code>
        <location>/500.jsp</location>
    </error-page>


See -  https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-860
fields.summary: Have an error page rather than 403 page when SVN permission denied

fields.description: Customers are starting to upgrade to 1.5 already and FE is failing for them, as SVNKit 1.1.* does not want to work with local 1.5 SVN repos. Having to switch to native client cen be either cumbersome, or even impossible for some customers - e.g. there is no Windows binary of the JavaHL for 1.5 yet
fields.summary: Add support for local SVN 1.5 repositories using pure java client

as per review notes
https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-117
fields.summary: improve catch-all svn symbolic regex

fields.description:
When I type in a search term with underscores FishEye seems to tokenize on the string on the underscores. This behaviour is the same when I quote the search term

For instance, I searched for: 
share_list_complete 

and got back:
share matched 194 revisions
list matched 9886 revisions
complete matched 953 revisions 

Same results if the string is quoted. This isn't ideal behaviour when you're searching code.
fields.summary: Search tokenizes on underscores

fields.description:
the find-file quicksearch must be very fast, it is currently very slow for some cases (eg when the query matches no files)

(stretch) autocomplete support in textbox
fields.summary: autocomplete and fast find-file

I was wonder if there is a way that I can reset the password.

fields.description:
When Fisheye's {{FisheyePluginSettings.storeConfig()}} updates its config.xml, it apparently just tries to blat new content over the old file. If your system has run out of disk space, this fails, and you're left with a zero-byte config.xml.

The safe way to modify a file is to create a temporary copy somewhere, and once it's successfully created, rename it
to where you want

Here is a stacktrace showing code that calls storeConfig(), which then loses the content:

{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: No space left on device
        at com.atlassian.sal.fisheye.pluginsettings.FisheyePluginSettings.storeConfig(FisheyePluginSettings.java:36)
        at com.atlassian.sal.fisheye.pluginsettings.FisheyePluginSettings.putActual(FisheyePluginSettings.java:69)
        at com.atlassian.sal.api.pluginsettings.AbstractStringPluginSettings.put(AbstractStringPluginSettings.java:34)
        at com.atlassian.studio.applinks.ApplicationInstances.store(ApplicationInstances.java:151)
        at com.atlassian.studio.applinks.TrustEstablisher.pollTrustedApp(TrustEstablisher.java:69)
        at com.atlassian.studio.applinks.TrustEstablisher.setUpTrustedApps(TrustEstablisher.java:57)
        at com.atlassian.studio.applinks.DefaultAppLinksManager.getApplicationInstances(DefaultAppLinksManager.java:152)
        at com.atlassian.studio.applinks.remote.DefaultApplicationLinker.getPrimaryApplication(DefaultApplicationLinker.java:64)
        at com.atlassian.studio.applinks.remote.DefaultApplicationLinker.getLinkedApplication(DefaultApplicationLinker.java:112)
        at com.atlassian.studio.navigation.TranslatingStudioNavbarInformationRetriever.getJiraKey(TranslatingStudioNavbarInformationRetriever.java:30)
        at com.atlassian.studio.navigation.TranslatingStudioNavbarInformationRetriever.getStudioNavbarInformation(TranslatingStudioNavbarInformationRetriever.java:41)
        at com.atlassian.studio.theme.fisheye.StudioThemeTag.getStudioNavbarInformation(StudioThemeTag.java:140)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor106.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
        at com.sun.el.parser.AstFunction.getValue(AstFunction.java:127)
        ... 65 more
Caused by: java.io.IOException: No space left on device
        at java.io.FileOutputStream.writeBytes(Native Method)
        at java.io.FileOutputStream.write(FileOutputStream.java:260)
        at org.apache.xmlbeans.impl.store.Cursor._save(Cursor.java:590)
        at org.apache.xmlbeans.impl.store.Cursor._save(Cursor.java:569)
        at org.apache.xmlbeans.impl.store.Cursor.save(Cursor.java:2526)
        at org.apache.xmlbeans.impl.values.XmlObjectBase.save(XmlObjectBase.java:177)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.RootConfig.saveConfig(RootConfig.java:196)
        at com.atlassian.sal.fisheye.pluginsettings.FisheyePluginSettings.storeConfig(FisheyePluginSettings.java:32)
        ... 80 more
{noformat}
fields.summary: Fisheye deletes its config.xml when the disk runs out of space
force-lowercase option does not always appear in admin screens

fields.description:
This will be useful for the following [API|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/The+FishEye+Remote+API] methods:

* changesets
* query

As they can return *large* numbers of results, depending on their arguments.

h4. changesets

This will be implemented by allowing the _optional_ specification of a *maxReturn* parameter. This will overrides the already present *maxReturn* (previously hardcoded to {{3000}}) and will be returned as part of the changesets object. To limit the impact on FishEye 3000 will be continue to be the highest specifiable max value.

h4. query

This will be implemented as an additional EyeQL clause, identical in syntax and function to SQL's [LIMIT clause|http://php.about.com/od/mysqlcommands/g/Limit_sql.htm]. This will facilitate paging and/or raw limiting of the number of results returned.
fields.summary: Allow limiting of number of results returned by remote API
"Data Types and Structures" information in the Remote API page

fields.description:
We have integrated FishEye with AD. I can login FishEye with my valid LDAP username and password,
but FishEye will create  automatically multiple account for "Jack", "JACK", "JAck". It's terriblefor us to manage user and group. Is there any way to make FishEye only create one account for one LDAP user?

Thanks,
fields.summary: FishEye username is case-sensitive, but LDAP is not

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# setup crowd auth
# add user to crowd
# log in to FE+CRU as that user
# while user is logged in, delete the user in the admin panel
# log out

What happens is at the moment of user's logout, a user account is re-created. The newly created "zombie" account has unknown password, uses built-in auth and has no access to Crucible.

This bug may be related to this support case: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-260, although I have not been able to reproduce the same problem as was described in the case
fields.summary: Deleting crowd-based user while the user is logged in results in user account being re-created on logout

fields.description:
*Page*: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/The+FishEye+Remote+API
\\ 
In the documentation and the built-in instance's doco (<HOSTNAME>/api), provides the following content under the [List Repositories|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/The+FishEye+Remote+API#TheFishEyeRemoteAPI-ListRepositories] XML-RPC section:
{noformat}
XML-RPC
    String[] getRepositories(String auth)
{noformat}

Whereas, the working example shipped together with a Fisheye instance (<HOSTNAME>/api/xmlrpc_example.py) suggested the following lines instead:
{noformat}
reps = server.listRepositories(auth)

print "found %i repositories" %(len(reps))
print reps
{noformat}

It appears that the working method is {{listRepositories(String auth)}} instead of {{getRepositories(String auth)}} outlined in the documentation.
fields.summary: "List Repositories" method in the remote API documentation

fields.description: Data types and structures for Path History is not documented in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/The+FishEye+Remote+API and FISHEYE_HOME/crucible/api/
fields.summary: Add data types and structures for Path History

fields.description:
> XML-RPC not working as specified? #2
> ------------------------------------
>
>                 Key: FSH-851
>                 URL: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-851
>             Project: Fisheye Support
>          Issue Type: Problem Report
>      Security Level: Reporter and Developers(Only the reporter of the issue and Atlassian can see it.)
>            Reporter: Yu Jye Foo
>            Assignee: Tony Cheah [Atlassian]
>
> The struct returned by "getRevision(...)" has an issue.
> The csid field is equivalent to the rev field. (Perforce SCM)
> struct Revision {
>       String path; // (REST: attribute)
>       String rev; // (REST: attribute)
>       String author; // (REST: attribute)
>       Date date; // (REST: attribute)
>       String state; // one of "changed" "added" or "deleted" (REST: attribute)
>       int totalLines; // (REST: attribute)
>       int linesAdded; // (REST: attribute)
>       int linesRemoved; // (REST: attribute)
>       String log;
>       String csid; // optional (REST: attribute)
>       String ancestor; // optional (REST: attribute)
>     }
> Suppose in CSID 11111, I made the 7th submission to a particular file, in this case, shouldn't rev be 7 and csid be 11111?
> Right now, they are both equivalent. There appears to be no way to retrieve the info on it being the "7th submission" at the moment although this data is stored in the FishEye server.

--------------
It was suggested that I raise this as a New Feature request.
fields.summary: Track file revision in Perforce
upgrade to webwork 2.2.7 (fixes security problem)

fields.description:
Suppose you have the following structure of your SVN repo:

trunk: ProjectName/ProductGeneration/trunk/Component
branches: ProjectName/ProductGeneration/branches/BranchName/Component

When you try to use the following setup (IMO valid):
{noformat}
<trunk regex="(.+)/trunk(/|$)" logical="${1}" name="${1}~trunk"/>
<branch regex="(.+)/branches/([^/]+)" logical="${1}" name="${1}~${2}" />
{noformat}

you hit some problems.
First of all for branches "/" in container id will be replaced with "-", e.g.
Path: MyProduct/NextGeneration/branches/MyBranch/MyComponent/
Container: branch:MyProduct-NextGeneration~MyBranch
whereas for trunk it will not (i.e. "/" will remain). e.g.
Path: MyProduct/NextGeneration/trunk/MyComponent/
Container: trunk:MyProduct/NextGeneration~trunk  
(please observe / and - between MyProduct  and NextGeneration in both cases).

It leads to problems when you want to filter your view while browsing directories by applying branch filter. Filtering for branches will work, but selecting trunk in Constraint->branch combobox in such case will always result in:
{noformat}
404 - Not Found
The requested resource cannot be found.
Referer: http://XXX:8060/browse/Repository
no such repository - MyGeneration~trunk 
{noformat}
fields.summary: HTTP 404 when SVN symbolic setup for trunk matches "/"

fields.description:

Would be great to have "Add repository" link also in the upper part of the page.

Settings this priority to trivial, as I believe adding a new repository is not so very frequent.
Anyway it would be nice to have.

fields.description:
This problem occurs in a very special conditions and it was nontrivial to forge such SVN repository which proves FishEye has a bug here.
This bug occur when all the following conditions apply:
* SVN and FishEye server must run on some Unix/Linux machines (supporting symbolic links)
* directories must include special characters which must be escaped while building URL, e.g + or % (e.g. branches/release-bugA+bugB+bugC)
* there must be a symbolic link inside such directory
* such directory has been moved (svn move) from outside repository (as configured in FishEye) into it (e.g. whole real SVN repository is http://server/svn, FishEye repository is http://server/svn/projectA and a directory with symbolic link has been moved from http://server/svn/projectB/a+c to http://server/svn/projectA)

The problem is that in such conditions FishEye follows such path in its scanning algorithm which leads to escaping *twice* special characters.
So at some moment http://server/svn/projectB/a+c/symlink is treated as http://server/svn/projectB/a%2Bc/symlink ("+" becomes "%2B"), but then incorrectly it becomes http://server/svn/projectB/a%252Bc/symlink (now % is unnecessarily escaped). 
When FishEye wants to retrieve from SVN repository information using such now corrupted URL it encounters exception and as result repository will not be further scanned at all.

The sample stack trace is:
{noformat}

ERROR - Problem processing revisions from repo file:///home/wseliga/lab/tmp/svnrepo/omitdir due to class com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.DbException - Problem getting diff information for rev39
com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.DbException: Problem getting diff information for rev39
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryScanner.slurpRevisionBlock(SvnRepositoryScanner.java:405)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.processRevisions(RepositoryScanner.java:435)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.slurpRepository(RepositoryScanner.java:342)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.slurp(RepositoryScanner.java:265)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.ping(RepositoryScanner.java:197)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryEngine.doSlurp(SvnRepositoryEngine.java:105)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.pingEngine(RepositoryHandle.java:390)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.processRequest(RepositoryHandle.java:140)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.processRequests(RepositoryHandle.java:127)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.queueRequest(RepositoryHandle.java:120)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryPinger$3$1.run(RepositoryPinger.java:151)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:885)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:907)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)
Caused by: com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.SvnDiffException: Exception walking dir for /omitdir/x+y+z@39
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.processOutsideCopy(DiffProcessor.java:539)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.processMessage(DiffProcessor.java:273)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffFetcher.process(DiffFetcher.java:64)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffFetcher.run(DiffFetcher.java:45)
	... 1 more
Caused by: com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: URL 'file:///home/wseliga/lab/tmp/svnrepo/omitdir/x%252By%252Bz/link3' non-existent in revision '39'
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient.info2(SvnThrottledClient.java:78)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.MessageInfo.getInfo(MessageInfo.java:108)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.MessageInfo.getInfo(MessageInfo.java:100)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.addNewFileChangeInfo(DiffProcessor.java:694)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.addRemoteInfo(DiffProcessor.java:568)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.access$100(DiffProcessor.java:44)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor$1.visitRemoteEntry(DiffProcessor.java:525)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.visitLocalCheckout(RepositoryWalker.java:192)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.checkOutAndWalk(RepositoryWalker.java:163)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.RepositoryWalker.walkDir(RepositoryWalker.java:92)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.processOutsideCopy(DiffProcessor.java:537)
	... 4 more
Caused by: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: URL 'file:///home/wseliga/lab/tmp/svnrepo/omitdir/x%252By%252Bz/link3' non-existent in revision '39'
	at org.tigris.subversion.javahl.JavaHLObjectFactory.throwException(JavaHLObjectFactory.java:435)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.javahl.SVNClientImpl.throwException(SVNClientImpl.java:1311)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.javahl.SVNClientImpl.info2(SVNClientImpl.java:1191)
	at org.tigris.subversion.javahl.SVNClient.info2(SVNClient.java:338)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient.info2(SvnThrottledClient.java:71)
	... 14 more
Caused by: org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNException: svn: URL 'file:///home/wseliga/lab/tmp/svnrepo/omitdir/x%252By%252Bz/link3' non-existent in revision '39'
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc.SVNErrorManager.error(SVNErrorManager.java:55)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc.SVNErrorManager.error(SVNErrorManager.java:40)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.wc.SVNWCClient.doInfo(SVNWCClient.java:2021)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.javahl.SVNClientImpl.info2(SVNClientImpl.java:1177)
	... 16 more
ERROR - Repository scanner paused.

{noformat}

I am settings priority to critical as it affects existing customers and they have no easy workaround other than excluding whole trees which contain URL-escaped characters.

Final hint: FAIK we don't need to escape + sign at at all. However the problem will anyway occur for other special characters in filenames.

fields.description:
I think this started with our last upgrade of Crucible/Fisheye - I subscribe to various RSS streams via NewNewsWire on OS X. The URL's embedded in the RSS no longer have the port (in this case 88). So none of them work anymore. So I get the description of each commit, but I can't click through to the fisheye website.

The weird thing is if I hit the RSS URL from Firefox, the RSS that comes back has the ports.

I confirmed with Wireshark that the response from Fisheye is missing the ports, and that it's not NetNewsWire that is stripping them out.

I will add some screenshots of the HTTP GET and response. The main differences I am seeing are in the UserAgent and the fact that Firefox is sending over my session cookie from Crucible. I forced a logout on the Firefox in case this was related to the presence of an active HTTP session, but Firefox was still sent the proper URL's in the response.
fields.summary: RSS Output over HTTP to User-Agent: NetNewsWire/3.1.6

fields.description:

- there is a constraint and it is deleted at that point, OR
- if no constraint: if it is extant on trunk do not mark as deleted

fields.summary: Allow the poll period for a repository to have a configurable global default

fields.description: One of the common questions on forums is "how long my scan will take" (or should take). I think that we're missing two things - better documentation (added separate issue for this) and a better progress indicator. It's great to know which revision is currently processed (and how much is left) but I think we could improve this - we could add some remaining time estimation into this message.
fields.summary: Add a progress bar (estimated time remaining) for all scans

fields.description:
One of the common questions on FE forums is "how long my scan should/will take". See for example http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257281154

I'd imagine that putting some common scenarios with some estimates would help people to know how much they should wait for the initial scan. 

Just an idea, decide if there's a point in doing something like that.
fields.summary: Add info that would help to determine how long an initial scan would take

fields.description:
The colon that trails each of the repository name looks out of place and dorky. It's also inconsistent with how Crucible projects get listed on the same page.

Could it be removed? :)
fields.summary: Remove the colon trailing repository names on the Fisheye home page

fields.description:
If I have a directory under Subversion (at file:///data/jirastudio/svn/root/JTP), and then delete it with {{svn rm}}, Fisheye will then repeatedly generate errors when it scans the repository:

{noformat}
 ERROR - Repository scanner paused.
 INFO  - file:///data/jirastudio/svn/root/JTPRepository scanner paused - resuming in 59 seconds 
 INFO  - Repository file:///data/jirastudio/svn/root/JTP resuming from pause
 ERROR - Problem processing revisions from repo file:///data/jirastudio/svn/root/JTP due to class com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException - org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: URL 'file:///data/jirastudio/svn/root/JTP' non-existent in revision '243'
 com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: URL 'file:///data/jirastudio/svn/root/JTP' non-existent in revision '243'
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient.info2(SvnThrottledClient.java:78)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryScanner.getLatestRevision(SvnRepositoryScanner.java:290)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.processRevisions(RepositoryScanner.java:412)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.slurpRepository(RepositoryScanner.java:342)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.slurp(RepositoryScanner.java:265)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryScanner.ping(RepositoryScanner.java:197)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryEngine.doSlurp(SvnRepositoryEngine.java:105)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.pingEngine(RepositoryHandle.java:390)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.processRequest(RepositoryHandle.java:140)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.processRequests(RepositoryHandle.java:127)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.queueRequest(RepositoryHandle.java:120)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryPinger$3$1.run(RepositoryPinger.java:151)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:650)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:675)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)
 Caused by: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: URL 'file:///data/jirastudio/svn/root/JTP' non-existent in revision '243'
        at org.tigris.subversion.javahl.JavaHLObjectFactory.throwException(JavaHLObjectFactory.java:435)
        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.javahl.SVNClientImpl.throwException(SVNClientImpl.java:1309)
        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.javahl.SVNClientImpl.info2(SVNClientImpl.java:1189)
        at org.tigris.subversion.javahl.SVNClient.info2(SVNClient.java:338)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient.info2(SvnThrottledClient.java:71)
        ... 14 more
 ERROR - Repository scanner paused.
 INFO  - file:///data/jirastudio/svn/root/JTPRepository scanner paused - resuming in 59 seconds
  .....
{noformat}
fields.summary: Fisheye logs errors forever when root directory is deleted
update doco re p4:jobid regex

fields.description: Make sure there are no UI settings that exist only in the cookie.
fields.summary: Ensure all user preferences are in user profile

fields.description:
Out of the box, fisheye appears to choose US ASCii as the default character set. Subversion uses UTF-8 by default and hence all subversion repositories should use UTF-8 as default.

This would have prevented a support call relating to foreign language file names and re-scanning.
fields.summary: SVN repositories default to UTF-8

fields.description:
This is needed to allow the [JIRA FishEye plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/FishEye+for+JIRA] to search for project-related changesets (& subsequently Crucible reviews) to display on the plugin's project tab panels.

See also [FISH-125|http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/FISH-125]
fields.summary: Support regex p4:jobid eyeql search clause

fields.description: When Fisheye cannot log into an SVN repository, it says "authentication cancelled", which is really not the problem.  the problem is that the authentication was actually attempted but it failed.  I was typing in the wrong password and got no indication of that.  Was sure of my password until I was using another tool which DID tell me auth failed.  I know it's trivial, but I wasted 30 minutes on something that should've take 10 seconds to fix.
fields.summary: Change "authentication cancelled" to "authentication failed"
next and previous links on diff and annotation pages
"Bad format for response:jira" error when attempting to get ID from JIRA 3.12.3

fields.description:
We have had some users request the ability to create a watch which contains more than one author in the constraint. They would like to be able to get e-mails about a handful of authors commits, either because they work with those people or they are managers for them.

We heavily use watches at Palm, so any enhancement to make them more sophisticated would be useful to us.
fields.summary: Allow user to create watch constraints containing multiple users

fields.description: author blame error on svn file replace
fields.summary: author blame error on svn file replace

fields.description:
Copied the {{crowd-integration-client-1.4.jar}} file into _FISHEYE_HOME/lib_ directory to integrate Fisheye/Crucible with Crowd 1.4 leads to the following error  during startup:

{noformat}
ERROR: problem running command
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.mainImpl(FishEyeCtl.java:105)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.main(FishEyeCtl.java:38)
Caused by: java.lang.IncompatibleClassChangeError
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth.setupProps(CrowdAuth.java:62)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth.<init>(CrowdAuth.java:48)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth.<init>(CrowdAuth.java:39)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.UserManager.reload(UserManager.java:165)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.UserManager.<init>(UserManager.java:105)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.RootConfig.openDB(RootConfig.java:817)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.RootConfig.start(RootConfig.java:280)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.mainImpl(Run.java:180)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.main(Run.java:39)
        ... 6 more
{noformat}

Causes Fisheye/Crucible unable to run and not accessible. 
A workaround is to revert to use {{crowd-integration-client-1.3.2.jar}} file instead. It still works with Crowd 1.4.
fields.summary: "java.lang.IncompatibleClassChangeError" with Crowd's client 1.4 in Fisheye/Crucible
FishEye to handle/skip obliterated changelist in Perforce

fields.description: When adding a new project, a couple of files in the repository needed to be excluded for security reasons.  The files were added to the Excludes like **/ldap.properties to exclude all copies of the file from being looked at by FishEye.  However, when the projects is scanned, the files are included and are visible.
fields.summary: Unable to exclude a file

fields.description:
When a user change  the  Display settings in the user profile, after 
a logout and a login (deleting temporary interent files in the middle
or doing the relogin in a different type of brower) all those settings which 
can be adjusted by radio buttons set back to the default values.
fields.summary: Customized display settings set back to default values after relogin

fields.description: I won't disagree with the pagination behavior on search results, but I'd like to have some way to inhibit it. I'd rather have a checkbox separate from the search (in both simple/advanced), but if I have to use eyeql, so be it.
fields.summary: I need some way to inhibit pagination on a search

fields.description: I'd love to be able to use eyeql filtering in the browse mode. I imagine being able to "browse" through all the changes in a changeset specified by "modified on branch ANT_15_BRANCH" or "between tags (ANT_MAIN_15FINAL, ANT_151_FINAL]". The directories without any changes would be hideable and the list view would only show revisions matching the eyeql filter. That kind of view to an arbitrary changeset would be sweet.
fields.summary: Allow eyeql browsing constraints

fields.description:
Currently Bamboo generates its diff links like so https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/viewrep/private/atlassian/bamboo/trunk/pom.xml?content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup&root=&r1=59102&r2=59103
Where we subtract 1 from the revision number we want and let fisheye do the calculations to see what number we really want to diff with.

This would be much nicer/neater if you could do something along the lines of 

r1=previous&r2=59103
fields.summary: Have a way to specify "previous" in a fisheye diff url

fields.description:
Bamboo generates its links to FIsheye using the following fomat.

https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/viewrep/private/atlassian/bamboo/trunk/pom.xml?content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup&root=&r1=59102&r2=59103

For SVN and CVS, Fisheye is smart enough to realise that 59102 doesn't exist and finds the time before that the file was changed and displays the diff for that instead.  This doesn't seem to be working for Perforce.
fields.summary: Calculating the correct version for diffs doesn't work for perforce

fields.description:
"included in" would include the revisions after the FROM revision and up-to-and-including the TO revisions.

So "where not included in any closed review" would find "gaps". Not everyone cares about gaps, but some people do.
fields.summary: extend cru eyeql so you can select "included in review"

fields.description:
src is http://jarjar.googlecode.com/files/jarjar-1.0rc7.jar

but its "home" http://www.mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.tonicsystems/jarjar does not contain the version we need
fields.summary: [mvn] upload jarjar 1.0rc7 into 3rdparty
